## üöÄ You Can Start Using This Today

### Minimal Setup (5 minutes)
```bash
# 1. Commit the files
git add .github/
git commit -m "Add Copilot skills for product-line expansion"

# 2. Done! Skills are discoverable in your repo
# Team can read .github/skills/ whenever needed
```

### Recommended Setup (10 minutes)
```markdown
# Add to your .github/copilot-instructions.md:

## Extending the System with AI Assistance

See `.github/skills/` for detailed guidance on:
- **SYSTEM_CONSTRAINTS.md** - Non-negotiable principles and gotchas
- **DECISION_FRAMEWORKS.md** - How to make architecture decisions  
- **COMMON_PATTERNS.md** - Tested, reusable code patterns

Use these when asking Copilot to add features or product lines.
```

## ‚ú® What This Framework Does

### Prevents Bugs
- ‚úÖ Lock contention (WITH NOLOCK guidance)
- ‚úÖ OFFSET pagination issues (cursor-based documented)
- ‚úÖ Hardcoded schemas (contract-driven enforced)
- ‚úÖ Broken atomicity (transaction patterns proven)

### Speeds Development
- ‚úÖ 21 copy-paste patterns ready to use
- ‚úÖ Decision trees for common debates
- ‚úÖ Code review checklist (reduces cycles)
- ‚úÖ Clear examples (WRONG vs. RIGHT)

### Aligns Teams
- ‚úÖ Shared understanding of system
- ‚úÖ Consistent decision-making
- ‚úÖ Explicit constraints documented
- ‚úÖ Proven patterns standardized

### Enables Copilot
- ‚úÖ Understands your architecture
- ‚úÖ Knows your gotchas
- ‚úÖ References proven patterns
- ‚úÖ Makes better suggestions

## üìû Quick Answers

**Q: Do I need to set up anything else?**  
A: No, files are ready to use immediately. Optional: Add reference to copilot-instructions.md (5 min).

**Q: Will Copilot automatically use these?**  
A: Partially. Best results if you reference them in prompts. See COPILOT_SETUP_GUIDE.md for options.

**Q: When do I create Phase 2?**  
A: After your first product-line expansion. Document what you learned first.

**Q: Can I modify these files?**  
A: Yes! They should evolve with your system. Update "Last Updated" date when you change them.

**Q: What if I disagree with a decision framework?**  
A: Update it to match your philosophy. These are templates, not gospel.
